intro: Macropodiella cussetiana, commonly known as the Cusset's arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes or along the edges of ponds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in water gardens.
